org.orgName: District Court of the United States

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application for Mac Fock for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
No. 2500. ORDER DIRECTING REPAYMENT OF DEPOSIT.

This matter coming on for hearing in open court this 5th day of September, A.D. 1913; and it appearing to the Court that an application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus was heretofore filed by said Mac Fock; and it further appearing to the Court that this cause came on for hearing on the 18th day of August, A.D. 1913, at which time the petitioner, Mac Fock was represented by his Counsel, Victor Place and L. Frank Brown, and the Commisioner of Immigration, Ellis De Bruler, was represented by Earl B Brockway, Assistant District Attorney; and it further appearing that after argument of Counsel, this Court did enter an order denying said Writ of Habeas Corpus, and directing that said Mac Fock be remanded to the United States Marshal for deportation; and it further appearing to the Court that said Mac Fock deposited with the Clerk of this Court the sum of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) to insure the payment of his board during the pendency of this action; and it further appearing to the Court that there became due for board because of the delay caused by this action, the sum of Sixty Dollars ($60.00), which said sum has been paid, the receipt for which is on file in this action:

Now, therefore, it is ordered adjudged and decreed that the Clerk of this Court do pay to Victor Place, Attorney for said Mac Fock, said sum of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00), heretofore filed, less whatever charges there may be against said One Hundred Dollars by reason of cost or otherwise.
Done in open court this 5th day of September, A.D. 1913.
